page.title: 16Sport/Leisure in Pontyclun
page.content: Pontyclun is reasonably well provided with sporting and leisure facilities.In the early years of this century it was felt that the rapidly growing community sorely needed a social centre.Accordingly, the local squire, Godfrey Clarke, built the Pontyclun Institute in 1910.Bowls, tennis and a variety of indoor games were provided.The institute provided a very valuable service for years, even being used as an army hospital in World War 1.Some years ago it was decided that the Rugby,Soccer and Cricket Clubs of the district should have a common centre and the Institute was put to that use.The sporting clubs have their own sports fields and in the Rugby Club's case, its own Clubhouse.In the adjacent areas there is also a Leisure Centre,a Golf Club a Cricket Club and a 400m running track.
